name: Historic Downtown Square
description: The heart of Cityville featuring beautifully preserved 19th-century architecture, boutique shops, and charming cafes. The square hosts weekly farmers markets and seasonal festivals throughout the year.

name: Riverside Park
description: A 50-acre park along the Cityville River featuring walking trails, picnic areas, a playground, and boat rentals. Perfect for family outings and outdoor recreation activities.

name: Cityville Art Museum
description: Home to an impressive collection of regional and contemporary art. The museum features rotating exhibitions, educational programs, and a sculpture garden.

name: Mountain View Observatory
description: State-of-the-art observatory offering public stargazing events and educational programs. Enjoy panoramic views of the city and surrounding mountains.

name: Heritage Village
description: Living history museum showcasing life in the 1800s with authentic buildings, costumed interpreters, and hands-on demonstrations of traditional crafts.

name: Cityville Farmers Market
description: Weekly market featuring fresh local produce, artisanal foods, handmade crafts, and live music. Open Saturdays from 8 AM to 2 PM year-round.

name: Adventure Sports Center
description: Premier destination for outdoor enthusiasts offering rock climbing, kayaking, hiking guides, and equipment rentals. Features both indoor and outdoor activities.

name: Cityville Botanical Gardens
description: Beautiful 20-acre botanical garden featuring native plants, themed gardens, walking paths, and a butterfly conservatory. A peaceful retreat in the heart of the city.
